page.title: 15Kirtle Kirk
page.content: Kirtle Kirk was built in 1840 and renovated in 1897 when the Bell Tower and Vestry were added. The foundation stone was laid by Mr Johnston Ferguson of Springkell. The original Kirk was built by Rev. John Irving of Bonshaw and is situated by the Lodge Gate to Bonshaw Tower. The Manse sits to the west of the Kirk on ground belonging to Bonshaw. The parish is linked with Eaglesfield. There is a Ladies Choir and Guild. Creca village has no church. There is an old mission hall now a dwelling house. Villagers attend Kirks and churches in neighbouring parishes.
